title.narrative: Poultry Enterprise Development Project Against Poverty in East Georgia

description.narrative: In this three-year project, Heifer Georgia will help 576 small-scale farm families improve their food security, incomes and nutrition levels at two locations covering eight villages of the Marneuli municipality in East Georgia. Through the establishment of poultry enterprises, women will have improved opportunities to start poultry-based micro-enterprises. One location will concentrate on geese husbandry, while the other will establish a turkey hatchery. Heifer Georgia will provide two incubators (3,000-egg capacity), imported hybrid eggs and enough feed to sustain growing nestlings for 40 days. With Heifer Georgia’s assistance, Phara, the project holder NGO, will construct incubators and renovate the hatchery for the gosling and turkey chicks. Phara will be responsible for incubator operation and feeding the goslings and turkey chicks during the first 40 days. One hundred fifty-seven original project participants will receive 20 (40-day-old) goslings or turkey chicks. During the lifespan of the project, four Passing on the Gift cycles will be conducted, and an additional 419 families will benefit. Project participants will be trained in advanced farm management, poultry farming and Heifer’s 12 Cornerstones. Heifer Georgia, on behalf of Phara, submitted a grant application for $72,845 to the Embassy of Japan in Georgia to purchase agricultural machinery for poultry feed production. The grant application has been approved by the Japanese Embassy, and in December 2009 Heifer Georgia signed the agreement. The machinery will be purchased in the February-March 2010 period.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
